Definitions.Paraphrase:
not processed, treated, or (of food) cooked 
未经加工或处理的，生的，未经烹饪的
raw material 
原材料
I prefer to eat vegetables raw, not cooked. 
我喜欢生吃蔬菜，不要煮。
She was wearing a jacket made of raw silk. 
她穿一件生丝做的外套。

[C] a chair on wheels for people who can't walk to get around 
轮椅
He spent the last ten years of his life in a wheelchair. 
他在轮椅上度过了一生中的最后10年。

[C] a sum of money paid regularly by the government or a private company to a person who does not work any more because they are too old or because they have become ill 
养老金，抚恤金
He finds it hard to live on his state pension. 
他发现靠政府抚恤金生活很困难。
He won't be able to draw / receive his pension until he's 65. 
他在65岁以前不可能拿到养老金。

[C]a social worker whose work involves the study of individuals or families with problems 
社会工作者

[C] a person or an organization who owns a building or an area of land which is paid for by other people who use it 
房东，地主
The landlord promised to redecorate the bedrooms before we moved in, but he still hasn't done it. 
房东答应在我们搬进来之前重新装修卧室，可他至今也没装修。

[C] a fixed amount of money sb. pays regularly for the use of a room, house, car, television, etc. that is owned by sb. else 
租金，租费
We let the spare room at a monthly rent of $100. 
我们把空房间以每月100美元的价格出租。
I pay a higher rent / more rent than the other tenants because my room is bigger. 
因为我的房间比较大，我付的租金比其他房客高。

pay or receive a fixed amount of money for the use of a room, car, television, etc. 
租借，租用，出租，出借
I rented a car from a garage and drove all around the city. 
我从车行租了辆车，满城兜风。
The old lady rented us her spare room for $50 a week. 
老妇人把空房间以每周50美元的价格出租给我们。

make a choice
选择，挑选
Anyone who opted to work full-time was busy six days a week, thirteen hours a day. 
选择做全日工的人一周忙6天，一天忙13个小时。
Against his father's advice, Peter opted for business. 
彼得违背父亲的意见, 选择了经商。

(up) encourage the development of（sth.）
大力争取支持；大力招揽顾客
We'll have to drum up more support / enthusiasm for business. 
我们不得不为了生意大力争取支持/鼓起热情。

[C] a musical instrument consisting of a skin stretched tight over a hollow circular frame, which is played by being hit with a hand or with a stick
鼓
the regular beat of the drum 
有规律的击鼓声
Jane plays drums in a local rock band. 
简在当地的一个摇滚乐队打鼓。

1. difficult 
困难的，棘手的
We've got a sticky problem to deal with. 
我们有个棘手的问题要处理。
There were a few sticky moments during the meeting. 
会议有几次陷入了僵局。
2. made of or covered with a substance that sticks to surfaces 
粘的，涂有胶水的
Don't touch the wet paint — it's sticky. 
别碰这湿漆——会粘手的。
His hands were sticky with jam. 
他的手上沾了果酱，粘糊糊的。
3. (of weather) hot and damp 
湿热的，闷热的
It's very sticky in New York in August. 
纽约8月份十分闷热。

1. [C] the state of being noticed by other people around 
引人注目的状态
The government is trying to keep a low profile on this issue. 
政府力图在这个问题上保持低姿态。
There are a growing number of women in high-profile positions. 
在政府引人注目的职位上，妇女的数量日益增加。
2. [C] a side view of a person's face 
面部的侧面（像）
She has a good strong profile. 
她侧面看上去美丽而坚毅。
The actor is photographed in profile, smoking a cigarette. 
这个演员从侧面拍了一张抽烟的照片。

1. (usu. passive) give (sb.) the right to do or have sth. 
给……权利
Being unemployed entitles you to free medical treatment. 
失业使你有权享有免费医疗。
The employer is entitled to ask for references. 
雇主有权索阅推荐函。
2. (usu. passive) give a title to (a book, film, etc.) 
给（书、电影等）定名，题名
She read a poem entitled "The Apple Tree". 
她读了一首名为《苹果树》的诗歌。

1. [U] the action of providing sth. good to balance or reduce the bad effects of damage, loss, injury, etc. 
补偿，弥补
Compensation of injured workers has cost the company a lot. 
对受伤工人的补偿花费了公司不少钱。
You should claim compensation. 
你应该要求赔偿。
2. [C] a thing, esp. an amount of money, given to compensate for sth. 
补偿金，补偿物，赔偿金
She received $50,000 in compensation for a lost eye. 
她得到了5万美金作为失去一只眼睛的补偿费。

[C] a person who tolerates different opinions or behaviour 
思想或行为开明的人

1. willing to tolerate behaviour, opinions, etc. different from one's own; open to new ideas 
心胸宽广的，开明的
a liberal person 
开明人士
a man of liberal views 
思想观点开明的人
2. giving or taking generously 
慷慨的，大方的
a liberal donation 
慷慨的捐赠
a liberal supporter of a hospital 
慷慨捐赠医院的人

1. almost; nearly 
几乎，差不多
The room was practically full. 
房间差不多已满了。
There's a gun in practically every American home. 
几乎每个美国家庭都有枪。
2. in a practical manner 
讲究实际地，从实用角度来说/看
Let's talk practically about the matter. 
咱们从实际出发来谈谈这个问题吧。
Practically, this book is more difficult than that one. 
实际上，这本书比那本难。

[C] a person who tries to find criminals or watches suspected people 
侦探
detective stories 
侦探小说
Detectives have finally tracked down the killer. 
侦探们最终追捕到了杀手。

stick sth. to sth. else or in a specified place, using a mixture of flour and water 
用浆糊粘贴 
paste a label on a box 
把标签贴在盒子上
The walls were pasted with pictures of movie stars. 
墙壁上贴满了电影明星的照片。

[C, U] a mixture of flour and water used to stick paper to a wall 
浆糊
wallpaper paste 
墙纸浆糊
When I put wallpaper up I got paste all over my hands and clothes. 
我贴墙纸时手上和衣服上全都沾满了浆糊。

1. [C] a written or printed statement that goods have been paid for 
收据，收条
Make sure you are given a receipt for everything you buy. 
一定要确保你买的每样东西都有一张收据。
I paid the bill and he gave me a receipt. 
我付了账单，他给了我一张收据。
2. [U] the receiving of sth.
收到
Please sign this form to acknowledge receipt of the money. 
请在这表格上签名表示已收到这笔钱。

[C, U] a gift of money or goods; the act of making a gift of money, clothes, food, etc. for a good cause, esp. to a charity 
捐赠的钱或物；捐赠
They received a large donation to the school. 
他们收到了给这所学校的大笔捐款。
She gave / made a donation of $200 to the Children's Hospital. 
她捐赠200美元给儿童医院。

[C] the part on each side of the human body between the top of the leg and the waist 
臀（部），髋（部），髋关节
She has never been the same after breaking that hip. 
自从髋骨骨折以后，她再也没有恢复到原来的样子。
She fell and broke her left hip. 
她摔倒了，折断了左髋关节。

1. move on hands and knees or with the front of the body on the ground 
爬行
The child crawled across the floor. 
这孩子爬过了地板。
There's an insect crawling down your sleeve. 
有只昆虫顺着你的袖子在往下爬。
2. move slowly 
缓慢地行进
The traffic was crawling along at ten kilometers per hour. 
车辆正以每小时10公里的速度缓慢地向前移动着。

[C] the line of linked bones running down the back of humans and many animals; the backbone 
脊柱，脊椎
She damaged her spine when she fell. 
她摔下来时，脊柱受到了损伤。
She seriously injured her spine in a riding accident. 
在骑马意外事故中她的脊柱严重受伤。

having to do with one's spine 
脊骨的，脊椎的
a spinal injury 
脊骨受伤
a spinal disorder 
脊椎病
His spinal cord was damaged. 
他的脊椎受到了损伤。

1. [C] an anatomical structure resembling a thin rope or thick string
索状组织，带
spinal cord 
脊椎
vocal cords 
声带
2. [C] a thin rope or thick string 
细绳，粗线
Have you got a bit of cord that I can tie this parcel up with? 
你能给我一根绳子捆这个包裹吗？

[C] a kind of nail that is driven into sth. with a firm twisting action 
螺丝，螺丝钉
He needed four strong screws for fixing the cupboard to the wall. 
他需要4个大螺丝钉把这个碗橱固定在墙上。

fix with a screw 
用螺丝钉固定
He screwed the handle to the door. 
他用螺丝钉把把手固定在门上。

[C] a tube-shaped piece of wood, metal, hard rubber, etc. that is used in a machine for crushing, pressing, printing, etc. 
(机器中的)滚筒，滚动物
a roller bearing 
滚柱轴承

[C] an apparatus for reducing movement of a vehicle and bringing it to a stop, esp. by means of pressure on the wheels 
闸，制动器，刹车
She had no brake on her bicycle. 
她的自行车上没有车闸。
His brakes failed on a slippery road. 
他的刹车在打滑的路面上失灵了。

put sth. down in writing as an official promise, statement, etc. 
证明
Here is a document certifying that I was born in France. 
这是证明我出生在法国的文件。
I hereby certify that the above information is true and accurate. 
兹证明上述情况属实且准确无误。

1. [C] an offer to pay a certain price at a sale, esp. at an auction  
(在拍卖等活动中买主的)喊价，出价，投标
Bids for building the bridge were invited from big firms throughout the country. 
已向全国几个大公司招标建造这座桥梁。
I made a bid of $150 for the painting. 
我出价150美元买这幅画。
2. [C] an attempt to obtain sth. 
企图得到
Her bid for re-election was unsuccessful. 
她再次竞选的努力没有成功。
He struggled with a prison guard and made a sudden bid for freedom. 
他突然与一名监狱看守搏斗起来，企图获得自由。

warn sb. that there may be danger, trouble ahead, etc. and that they should be ready to act; make sb. aware of sth. 
使警觉，使警惕，告知
The sign alerted me to thin ice. 
这块告示警告我冰层很薄。
We must alert the nation to the need to solve these problems. 
必须告诉全国人民解决这些问题的必要性。
An anonymous letter alerted police to the possibility of a terrorist attack at the airport. 
一封匿名信使警方对恐怖分子袭击机场的可能性有了警觉。

quick to see, understand and act in a particular situation 
警觉的，灵活的
You must be alert to possible dangers. 
你必须警惕潜在的危险。
She is old but still very alert. 
她年龄很大，但还是非常机敏。

[C] a device, machine or piece of equipment, esp. an electrical one that is used in the home 
器具，用具，（尤指）家用电器
electric / domestic / home / household appliances 
家用电器
The kitchen is equipped with modern electrical appliance. 
厨房里装有现代化的电器设备。

[C] a female servant
女佣，女仆
She told the maid to prepare some tea. 
她吩咐女佣准备茶水。

cooked in an oven, etc.
烤过的，烘过的
roast beef 
烤牛肉
roast pork 
烤猪肉

do the cooking or cook in an oven, or over a fire, etc. 
烤，烘
They roasted a chicken for me. 
他们为我烤了一只鸡。
roast a potato in ashes 
在灰烬中烘土豆

an enclosed space with a door, usu. part of a piece of equipment which is used to cook food or heat other substances 
烤炉，烤箱
microwave oven 
微波炉

1[C] a type of air-craft which is made to fly by a set of large fast-turning metal blades fixed on top of it, and which can land in a small space and take off without running over the ground 
直升飞机
Two helicopters have already been shot down. 
已有两架直升机被击落。

1. [C] a person who enthusiastically supports, defends or fights for a person, belief, right or principle 
斗士，拥护者
a champion of human rights 
人权拥护者
She has long been a champion of free speech. 
她很长时间以来一直是言论自由的拥护者。
2. [C] a person who has beaten or defeated all others in games, competitions, etc. 
冠军
this year's golf champion 
今年的高尔夫冠军
She is the world champion for the third year in succession. 
她是连续三年的世界冠军。

1. [C] a person who prepares and sells medicines 
药剂师，药商
The chemist made up my prescription immediately. 
药剂师立刻把我的处方配好了。
2. [C] a scientist who studies and works in chemistry 
化学家，化学师

1. (of a container) allow liquids or gases to get in or out when they shouldn't do 
漏，泄漏
The tin was leaking. 
罐头漏了。
The car leaked oil all over the drive. 
那辆车漏了一路的油。
2. (of liquid or gas) get in or out in this way 
（液体、气体等）漏，渗
The rain's leaking in. 
雨水漏了进来。
Air leaked out of the balloon. 
空气从气球中漏了出来。
3. allow (secret information) to become generally known 
泄漏（秘密）
He leaked the names to the press. 
他把名单泄漏给了新闻界。

[C] a hole, crack, etc. through which liquid or gas may wrongly get in or out 
漏洞，漏隙
a leak in the roof 
屋顶漏隙
You'd better repair that leak in the fuel pipe. 
你最好修理一下燃料管道的裂缝。

[C] a politician who has been elected to a Senate
参议员
Only two senators voted against the bill. 
只有两名参议员投票反对该议案。

a person in charge of a particular political unit 
州长，总督，统治者
Three US state governors have put themselves forward as presidential candidates. 
三位美国州长成为总统候选人。

live, continue, grow or develop well and vigorously 
兴旺发达，茁壮成长
Insects thrive well in a warm climate. 
昆虫在温暖的气候中容易繁殖。
Flowers will not thrive without sunshine. 
花没有阳光不会茂盛。

prove or declare sb. guilty 
（经审讯）证明 ... ... 有罪，宣判 ... ... 有罪
She was convicted of theft. 
她被判犯了盗窃罪。
There wasn't enough evidence to convict him. 
没有足够证据证明他有罪。

Definitions.PartofSpeech:
meet (sth. bad or difficult) 
面对
They were faced with financial difficulties. 
他们面临经济困难。
Faced with the evidence, he had to confess. 
面对证据，他不得不坦白。

encourage the development of (sth.) 
大力争取，大力招揽（顾客）
I don't think that politician can drum up much support with all his speeches.
我认为那个政客再怎么发表演讲也不会得到多少人的支持。
Manufacturers are offering big discounts to drum up business.
生产厂家正提供很大的折扣来招徕生意。

in a secret way 
背地里，私下
They were charged with taking money under the table.
他们被指控私下拿钱。
Their distributors are here selling their films at the festival market but they're doing it under the table.
他们的发行人在节日市场销售他们的电影，可是他们私底下也在销售。

be part of , included in, mixed up, or deeply concerned with (sth. or doing sth.) 
卷入，介入，参与
They had been deeply involved in the crimes.
他们深深地卷入了犯罪活动。
More than 100 people are involved in the project.
一百多人参与了这个项目。
I don't want to get involved in your family arguments.
我不想卷入你的家庭争论。

in one's true feelings 
在内心深处，在心底
Deep down (inside you), I know you love me really.
在你心底里，我知道你是真心爱我的。
Deep down, he knew he was at fault.
在心底里，他明白自己错了。

trick sb. or make him or her appear stupid in some way 
愚弄某人
He'd been made a fool of. 
他被人耍了。
Your brother is making a fool of you. 
你兄弟在愚弄你。

reply rudely 
顶嘴
In his youth he lost several jobs, just because he dared to talk back.
他年青时，只不过因为敢顶嘴，就失业了好几次。
He knew better than to talk back to his father.
他知道最好还是不要和他父亲顶嘴。

fail to work; stop working 
发生故障，坏掉
The telephone system has broken down. 
电话线路出故障了。
Our car broke down on the freeway. 
我们的车在高速公路上抛锚了。

move or travel round 
四处走动
It is difficult for her to get around without a cane. 
她不用拐杖就寸步难行。
News soon got around that he had resigned. 
有关他辞职的消息马上传开了。

discover and examine the facts about a problem or situation
调查，仔细检查
Police are looking into the disappearance of two children. 
警察正在调查两名儿童失踪的事情。
There seems to be an electrical problem. I'll get someone to look into it. 
好像电路出毛病了，我得找个人检查一下。

complete (sth. such as a form) 
填写
To order, fill out the coupon on page 54. 
想要订购此商品，请填好第54页上的优惠券。
Mick had a beer at the airport bar while Alex filled out the car rental form. 
米克在机场酒吧里喝啤酒时，亚历克斯填写了租车单。

be or give a reason for (sth. or doing sth.) 
解释，说明（原因等）
We have to account for every penny we spend on business trips. 
我们得把出差花费的每一分钱都说明清楚。
How do you account for this sudden disappearance of all the money? 
你如何解释所有的钱一下子没了？

develop or increase sth. gradually
逐步建立，逐步建设
She's built up a very successful business. 
她建立起了一家非常成功的企业。
The gallery has built up a fine collection of contemporary art. 
这家美术馆收藏了不少精美的当代艺术作品。
We've built up good relationships with our clients. 
我们与客户建立了良好的关系。

experience, endure or suffer (sth.) 
经历，遭受，蒙受
She's been going through a bad patch recently. 
最近她的日子很难过。
He's amazingly cheerful considering all he's had to go through. 
考虑到他所经历的一切，他的乐观是令人惊讶的。

be easily used for a particular activity or result
适宜于（某事），有助于（某事），会造成（某结果）
This hot weather lends itself to sleeping. 
这种热天很容易让人昏昏欲睡。
Some novels quite readily lend themselves to adaptation as plays; others do not. 
有些小说很适合改编成剧本，有些却不合适。

declare (sb.) guilty of (a crime); persuade (sb.) to believe the truth of (sth. he or she has done wrong) 
判决……有罪，使深感有罪，使服罪
The jury convicted the accused man of theft. 
陪审团宣判被告犯有偷窃罪。
He was convicted of murder. 
被判犯有谋杀罪。
